intro: Tetramicra bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored tetramicra, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Tetramicra bicolor is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and habitat preferences.
